"Tambascio, Larry" wrote

> The trick of subclassing the object you're testing to override and provide
> mock implementations of dependencies may not work with MockStrutsTestCase,
> because it's bound to the struts-config file to invoke the execute method.
> Seems like there should be some way to override that configuration to 
> point
> to the subclass, but I'm not sure how much that would buy you.

We use a subclass of MockStrutsTestCase to allow us to do just that.  It has 
a setAction() method which allows you to pass in a subclass instance for 
testing purposes.  It still checks, however, that the object you pass in is 
a valid subclass of whatever is specified in struts-config.

This seems to be a big need out there, since I have received no less than 
25-30 requests for this code since I posted something about in January.  So 
I guess I should put it up somewhere accessible.

I just had our sysadmin post it.  See

http://www.digitalfocus.com/JeffsJava/AbstractStruts11TestCase.html

I hope this is helpful.
